channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Top 5 moments from Trump's Fox News town hall in key battleground state: 'World War III territory'
item.description: Former President Donald Trump joined Fox News' Sean Hannity in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, for a town hall event, where he fielded questions from voters.

item.title: Barron Trump, Donald Trump's youngest son, has enrolled at New York University
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's youngest son, Barron Trump, began his freshman year of college this week at New York University, his father said Wednesday.

item.title: School Choice Is Not a Secret Plot to Promote ‘Christian Nationalism’
item.description: Complete educational freedom would make it impossible for any single ideological faction to take over. The same cannot be said about the public-school system.

item.title: RNC Launches Pennsylvania Supreme Court Appeal Over Decision Scrapping Requirement To Properly Date Ballots
item.description: The state's high court already upheld the date requirement, but left-wing forces are once again attempting a judicial override.

item.title: Hunter Biden's criminal tax trial begins with jury selection in California
item.description: Jury selection in Hunter Biden’s criminal tax trial in California, stemming from special counsel David Weiss’ yearslong investigation into the first son, begins Thursday.

item.title: Secret Service seeks attendees for LGBTQ summit at Disney World as campaign season heats up
item.description: The Secret Service failed to protect former President Donald Trump and the embattled agency will be taxed to the limit by the peak of presidential-campaign season. But it will be well-represented at an LGBTQ summit at Disney World.

item.title: Republicans’ Chances of Taking the Senate Are Looking Great
item.description: Even if Harris sweeps the swing states and wins the White House, a whole lot would have to go wrong for the GOP to remain in the Senate minority.

item.title: Lawsuit: Arizona’s 15 Counties Are Failing To Remove Noncitizens From The Voter Rolls
item.description: Arizona's counties are failing to undertake procedures to ensure noncitizens are removed from the voter rolls, an 'amended' lawsuit alleges.

item.title: Trump to skip federal court hearing Thursday, plead not guilty to charges in Jack Smith's election case
item.description: Lawyers are expected to enter a not guilty plea on behalf of former President Trump in a federal court arraignment in Washington, D.C., Thursday.

item.title: Jimmy McCain, son of the late John McCain, registers as a Democrat and backs Kamala Harris
item.description: Jimmy McCain, a son of former Arizona senator and 2008 Republican presidential nominee John McCain, said this week he has registered as a Democrat and will vote for Vice President Kamala Harris, a valuable nod of support for the Democratic nominee in a battleground state.

item.title: The Beautiful Presidency
item.description: Trump promises to provide the most aesthetically pleasing administration you’ve ever seen.

item.title: California Law Mandating Indoctrination Of Students On Climate Change Goes Into Effect This Year
item.description: The bombardment of doomsday climate commentary has already contributed to widespread environmental anxiety among children and young adults.

item.title: Southern border crisis helped spur massive spike in crossings from Canada as well: expert
item.description: The spike in migrant crossings at the northern border have happened in part because resources have been diverted to help solve the crisis at the southern border.

item.title: Former GOP Rep. Liz Cheney crosses party lines to endorse Kamala Harris
item.description: Former Republican Rep. Liz Cheney on Wednesday said she would support Kamala Harris for president, ending weeks of speculation about how fully the member of a GOP dynasty-turned-Trump critic would embrace the Democratic ticket.

item.title: Sculptor Daniel Giordano: Part Wizard, Part Storyteller, All Artist
item.description: The Newburgh, N.Y., artist is unclassifiable, in a good way.

item.title: Biden Admin Dismisses Noncitizen Voting Because It’s ‘Already Illegal’ (Just Like Shoplifting And Drunk Driving)
item.description: Jean-Pierre should know better than anyone that just because something is 'already illegal' doesn't mean it's not happening.

item.title: How Trump, or Kamala, could win, as all sides zero in on the debate
item.description: With next Tuesday's debate in pundits' crosshairs, few appear comfortable admitting that the presidential election, as it stands today, is about as evenly-matched as you can get.

item.title: That photo of people wearing 'Nebraska Walz's for Trump' shirts? They're distant cousins
item.description: A sister of Democratic vice presidential nominee Tim Walz says she doesn't recognize the people wearing "Nebraska Walz's for Trump" T-shirts in a photo that is making the rounds on social media. It turns out they are distant cousins.

item.title: Our Price-Controlled Economy
item.description: The latest proposals by Harris to manage inflation through price controls on drugs, rents, and food are piling on to our already price-controlled economy.

item.title: Indictment Of Yet Another Alleged Chinese Agent Proves Democrats Have A China Problem
item.description: Democrats’ willingness to open the door for Chinese agents has only tightened communist China’s grip on the U.S.
